channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road markings warn out, 7th January
item.description:
Old road markings that were sprayed out are now showing causing a confusion lane situation. It use to be 2 lanes and converted to one lane. Traffic is getting confused with old markings now showing creating two flows of traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thurlow Park Road, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Lots of litter Hazelbourne Road / junction with Westfield terrace

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazelbourne Road, Clapham, Greater London

item.title: Drain/access cover on pavement caved in, dangerous, 7th January
item.description:
A drain or access cover set into the pavement seems to have caved in, opening up a hole to the void underneath. It looks like it could get worse and is a serious trip/fall/worse hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 129,131, South Croxted Road, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 7th January
item.description:
Fly tipping blocking path. Tables and christmas trees

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This place is always full of rubbish and it's never ending, 7th January
item.description:
People keep throwing the rubbish here for many many years now and no measures have been taken by the council. You can't educate some people ,but at least you can prevent it by at least installing a CCTV or some announcement boards with the information. It is disgusting to walk near here and even dangerous for peope,as someone left a big broken glass and mirror. Please take some actions as this is getting worse and worse and can not be avoided anymore.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burst water pipe, 7th January
item.description:
There is a burst pipe on the street which causes flooding in the bus stop outside out house. The pavement is also very slippery due to icing which is very dangerous, especially for elderly and parents with children etc
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Maberley Road, South Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building waste dumped outside San House, 7th January
item.description:
Between 16.45 & 15.15, a man in a white van dumped a large amount of building waste in front of San House, Bradstock Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bradstock Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Lighting fixtures/ building materials dumped on street, 7th January
item.description:
7 Jan 26 - looks like a recent dump of building materials On Englefield Road - outside side of house on corner of Southgate Road and Englefield Road Please remove asap - helps to prevent further dumping Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southgate Road, Hackney, London

item.title: The street lamp lights not working in St Giles park, 7th January
item.description:
Hi, the main strip of street lamps aren't working in St Giles park. This is the only park that's open to walk the dog after 6pm and I would feel much safer if the lights worked please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell Church Street, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping continues in 2026, 7th January
item.description:
More fly tipping on Arnold Estate where Sweeney Crescent meets Devon Mansions. This time it's timber from household renovations. Fly tipping has been occuring here regularly for the past six months, at least while I've been noticing. I will keep reporting it until something is done by Southwark Council to prevent it. Cleaning up after fly tippers only encourages them to keep doing it. Please address this issue properly and stop wasting council money cleaning up after fly tippers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sweeney Crescent, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fenham Road - Road Flower Beds, 7th January
item.description:
The flower beds (or rubbish dumping grounds) which are in front of my house are NEVER cleaned. Why does our street, which isn't a through road NEVER cleaned? Its not acceptable

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fenham Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Motorbike business van idling and illegal parking, 7th January
item.description:
Motorbike business van sat idling, left engine on, for an hour in evenings and extended periods each morning on yellow lines - air and sound pollution for nearby residents on residential street, please have a word
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing electrical recycling container, 7th January
item.description:
There is a recycling bin for electrical items near the zebra crossing on the station side. It has clearly not been emptied for a long while. Since Christmas people have put their recycling beside it as they cannot fit anything else into the hopper. The pavement is getting clogged at this point. This looks a mess and is dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Park, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
